intro: Perezia mandonii, commonly known as the Mandonii perezia, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant features strap-like, evergreen leaves that form a dense rosette near the ground. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Perezia mandonii is considered a species of conservation concern.
